input:
Manchester United 1 - 1 Arsenal

First Half:

10:27 Caption: Ashley Young (Manchester United) delivers a promising cross into the box, but it's cleared.

13:11 Event: Foul by Arsenal
13:28 Caption: Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Michael Dean blows his whistle for an infringement. Manchester Utd win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
14:17 Event: Direct free-kick by Manchester United
14:48 Caption: Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with an accurate shot from the free kick, which is placed dangerously close to the penalty area. However, David Ospina pulls off a great save to deny his drilled attempt towards the middle of the goal.

17:02 Event: Foul by Manchester United
17:19 Caption: The referee blows his whistle as Chris Smalling (Manchester United) was too aggressive in his challenge.
18:18 Caption: One of the defenders reacts at the last minute to brilliantly block a pass from Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal).
19:36 Event: Ball out of play
19:46 Event: Throw-in by Manchester United
19:52 Event: Ball out of play
19:58 Event: Throw-in by Manchester United
20:22 Caption: Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) sends a long ball across the pitch, but it misses its target.

22:40 Event: Ball out of play
22:57 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal

23:51 Caption: Ashley Young (Manchester United) fails to find a teammate across the pitch with a long ball.

25:38 Event: Foul by Manchester United
25:57 Caption: Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Michael Dean no option but to blow his whistle.
26:29 Event: Ball out of play
26:43 Caption: Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) sends a pass into the box, but the opposition's defence is alert to the danger and makes a clearance.
26:45 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal

28:46 Caption: Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Michael Dean blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion.
28:57 Event: Ball out of play
29:11 Event: Throw-in by Manchester United
29:19 Event: Goal by Manchester United
29:51 Caption: It's a goal! Ander Herrera (Manchester United) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Ashley Young. The score is now 1:0.
30:05 Event: Clearance by Arsenal
31:11 Caption: An attempted cross from Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) is cleared.
32:07 Caption: A pass by Ashley Young (Manchester United) ends up in no man's land, and the attacking effort comes to an end.
32:28 Caption: Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) sends in a pass which fails to reach any of his teammates.
34:03 Caption: A crossfield pass from Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) fails to find any of his teammates.
34:19 Event: Shots off target by Manchester United
34:41 Caption: Ander Herrera (Manchester United) receives a pass and unleashes a shot which goes well wide of the right post.
34:49 Event: Clearance by Arsenal
34:55 Event: Ball out of play

35:23 Event: Foul by Arsenal
35:43 Caption: Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) jumps into a tackle and Michael Dean blows his whistle for a foul.
37:05 Event: Foul by Arsenal
37:22 Caption: Per Mertesacker (Arsenal) gives away a foul for a fierce tackle on an opponent.
37:28 Event: Offside by Manchester United
37:47 Caption: Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) sends a beautiful cross into the penalty area, but the opposition's defence manages to clear the ball to safety.
37:50 Caption: The linesman raises his flag. Falcao (Manchester United) is adjudged offside.
38:32 Caption: Michael Dean blows his whistle and it's Falcao (Manchester United) who is penalised for an offensive foul. Good decision by the referee.
39:17 Event: Offside by Arsenal
39:35 Caption: Flag goes up against Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) and the referee blows his whistle for offside.
39:53 Event: Foul by Manchester United
40:25 Event: Foul by Manchester United
41:08 Event: Indirect free-kick by Arsenal
41:18 Caption: Phil Jones (Manchester United) commits a minor foul to interrupt the attacking move of his opponent and is warned by the referee that he will get a yellow card if he does it again. Arsenal earn a free kick.
41:27 Event: Ball out of play
41:43 Event: Throw-in by Manchester United
41:55 Caption: Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) delivers a poor cross from a free kick as one of the defenders comfortably clears it away.
42:28 Caption: Ander Herrera (Manchester United) is unable to feed a through ball into the path of his teammates.
43:24 Event: Ball out of play
43:33 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
44:04 Event: Foul by Arsenal
44:27 Caption: Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) gives away a foul for a clumsy challenge. Referee Michael Dean saw the whole situation. Manchester Utd are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
44:47 Event: Indirect free-kick by Manchester United
45:18 Caption: Daley Blind (Manchester United) gets in a good position to shoot just outside the box after a nice pass, but his effort is unintentionally blocked by one of his teammate.
45:40 Caption: Daley Blind (Manchester United) sees his long-range effort blocked. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Manchester Utd will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
45:51 Caption: Ashley Young (Manchester United) takes the corner with a short pass.
46:03 Caption: Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) attempts to find the head of one of his teammates with a promising cross into the box, but a defender outjumps the attackers and averts the threat.
46:24 Caption: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
46:59 Caption: Today's clash hasn't been that attractive up to now, but it hasn't been a total borefest. There have been a few nice movements for both sides. Manchester Utd dominated the opening period and easily created the most chances. The home players have grown in confidence and started to string some passes together. The visiting side have relied on their defence and counter-attacks.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Arsenal
00:00 Caption: Fourth official shows 1 min. of added time.
00:01 Caption: The second half has just started.
00:18 Event: Ball out of play
00:24 Event: Throw-in by Manchester United
00:44 Caption: Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) deprives his opponent of the ball, but the referee blows his whistle for a foul. He's not happy with the decision!
00:49 Event: Foul by Manchester United

02:54 Event: Foul by Arsenal
03:08 Event: Ball out of play

03:23 Caption: Per Mertesacker (Arsenal) commits a rough foul. Michael Dean stops the game and makes a call. That's a free kick to Manchester Utd.
03:41 Caption: Falcao (Manchester United) takes a short free kick.
03:47 Caption: Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) crosses into the box from near the side line, but he doesn't connect as he wanted and it's cleared by the well-organized defence.
04:17 Caption: A pass from Ashley Young (Manchester United) is intercepted by David Ospina and the move breaks down.

05:50 Event: Shots off target by Arsenal

06:12 Caption: Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
06:21 Event: Clearance by Manchester United

09:39 Event: Ball out of play

10:20 Caption: Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) swings in the corner, but it's comfortably cleared away.

14:08 Caption: Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) attempts to find some of his teammates with a dangerous pass from the edge of the box. The opponent's defence, however, intercepts the effort and clears the ball to safety.
15:13 Event: Ball out of play

15:36 Caption: The referee allows time for a substitution. Falcao will be replaced by Robin van Persie (Manchester United).

17:09 Event: Shots on target by Arsenal
17:28 Event: Ball out of play
17:28 Caption: Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but David de Gea is alert and denies him. Arsenal have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
17:54 Event: Corner by Arsenal
18:08 Event: Ball out of play

18:55 Event: Ball out of play

20:08 Caption: Santi Cazorla (Arsenal)'s poor effort is easily saved by David de Gea. He connects well with a cross, but mistimes it a little, and it heads towards the middle of the target and straight into the grateful hands of the goalkeeper.
20:24 Event: Throw-in by Manchester United
21:07 Event: Offside by Manchester United

21:53 Event: Ball out of play

23:10 Caption: A poorly executed mid-range free kick by Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) as he fails to deliver a decent cross.
23:35 Caption: The linesman raises his flag for offside before Ashley Young (Manchester United) heads on.

25:19 Event: Corner by Arsenal
25:34 Caption: The resulting corner, taken by Mesut Ozil (Arsenal), comes to nothing.
25:46 Event: Ball out of play

26:51 Event: Substitution by Arsenal

28:58 Caption: Louis van Gaal is forced to make a change. David de Gea is unable to continue due to injury, Victor Valdes (Manchester United) comes on.
29:01 Event: Substitution by Manchester United

30:31 Event: Ball out of play
30:47 Caption: Ashley Young (Manchester United) delivers a long ball, but it lacks enough power to reach his teammates and is intercepted by one of the defenders. Manchester Utd force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
31:04 Event: Corner by Manchester United
31:13 Caption: Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) takes the corner but it's cleared.
31:42 Event: Ball out of play

33:47 Caption: Chris Smalling (Manchester United) sends a long ball across the pitch, but it misses its target.
34:14 Event: Foul by Arsenal
34:34 Caption: It looks like Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) saw red with that tackle. Michael Dean won't tolerate such behaviour on the pitch and blows for a foul.
34:36 Event: Ball out of play
34:54 Caption: Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) fails to send a pass into the box as his effort is cut out. Manchester Utd have a corner.
35:11 Event: Corner by Manchester United

35:38 Event: Ball out of play

36:34 Event: Goal by Arsenal
36:58 Caption: What a bad luck! Tyler Blackett (Manchester United) got in the way of a pass and unintentionally sent the ball past his own goalkeeper. The score is 1:1.
37:17 Event: Kick-off by Manchester United
38:02 Event: Shots on target by Manchester United
38:30 Caption: David Ospina makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded by Chris Smalling (Manchester United) after a cross from the side.
38:37 Event: Shots off target by Arsenal
38:52 Event: Clearance by Manchester United
38:57 Caption: Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
39:12 Event: Ball out of play

40:07 Event: Clearance by Manchester United

41:59 Event: Ball out of play
42:03 Event: Throw-in by Manchester United
42:28 Event: Ball out of play
42:45 Caption: David Ospina doesn't have to worry about this one. Marouane Fellaini plays a pass into the feet of Robin van Persie (Manchester United), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes high over the bar.
43:01 Event: Clearance by Arsenal
43:19 Event: Shots on target by Arsenal
43:39 Caption: A neat pass is well received by Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the middle of the target. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
44:07 Event: Offside by Manchester United
44:28 Caption: Robin van Persie (Manchester United) is flagged for offside.
44:53 Event: Substitution by Arsenal
44:57 Caption: Substitution. Alexis Sanchez leaves the pitch and is replaced by Mathieu Flamini (Arsenal).
45:34 Event: Foul by Manchester United
46:09 Event: Indirect free-kick by Arsenal
46:11 Caption: Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) makes a rough challenge and Michael Dean blows his whistle for a foul. It's a free kick to Arsenal, but they probably won't attempt a direct shot on goal from here.
46:19 Caption: The resulting set piece, sent into the penalty area by Mesut Ozil (Arsenal), was easily dealt with by one of the defenders.
46:55 Event: Offside by Manchester United
47:15 Caption: Flag up against Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United). He had space to move into behind the defence, but he went too soon.
47:57 Event: Ball out of play
48:05 Event: Throw-in by Manchester United
48:50 Caption: Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) dinks a cross into the box in an attempt to find one of his teammates, but the defence manages to clear.
48:55 Event: Ball out of play

49:49 Event: Foul by Manchester United
49:55 Event: Yellow card by Manchester United
49:58 Caption: This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Ander Herrera (Manchester United) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
50:10 Event: Ball out of play
50:30 Caption: Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
50:59 Caption: We saw a few chances and nice plays, but the overall impression of the game is uninspiring and not hugely entertaining. A very even game was seen on the pitch today. Both sides tried to combine well and to keep the ball at their feet.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a closely contested Premier League clash at Old Trafford, Manchester United and Arsenal played out a 1-1 draw, a result that encapsulated the ebb and flow of a closely fought encounter. The match provided moments of high drama, excellent individual performances, and tactical battles that saw both teams share the spoils.

As the referee blew his whistle to start the match, Manchester United kicked off proceedings, keen to impose their will early on. However, within the first few minutes, possession oscillated between the two teams with Arsenal trying to gain a foothold. The first tangible action came in the 6th minute when Manchester United had a shot off target, an early sighter and a sign of intent from Louis van Gaal's side.

The gameâ€™s first clear chance arrived in the 9th minute when Manchester United earned a corner. From the resulting set-piece, a rebound fell to Chris Smalling, whose attempt was blocked, sparing Arsenalâ€™s blushes. Juan Manuel Mata and Ashley Young, in quick succession, delivered crosses that the Arsenal defense managed to clear desperately. The open play was briefly interrupted by stoppages and minor fouls, but the match quickly picked back up.

Manchester United continued to press forward and were clearly the more threatening side. Their persistence nearly paid off when Juan Manuel Mataâ€™s free-kick in the 14th minute was expertly saved by Arsenal goalkeeper David Ospina, a moment of brilliance that kept the game scoreless.

Arsenal, for their part, also tried to establish their game, with Hector Bellerin and Alexis Sanchez pushing forward, but found themselves repelled by a well-organized United defense. Mis-passes and throw-ins became frequent, breaking the momentum. Midway through the half, an offside call against Falcao highlighted United's attempts to penetrate the Arsenal backline repeatedly.

The match finally saw a breakthrough in the 29th minute. Manchester United took the lead through Ander Herrera. Ashley Youngâ€™s superb lofted pass into the box was met by Herrera, whose precision finish into the bottom corner left David Ospina with no chance. Old Trafford erupted as the home side took a deserved lead, reflecting their dominance in the opening exchanges.

Thereafter, the game saw a flurry of activity. Arsenal tried to hit back immediately, with Mesut Ozil and Aaron Ramsey combining in attack, but they were unable to find a decisive ball. Manchester United, meanwhile, sought to double their lead with Ander Herrera and Antonio Valencia probing the Arsenal defense.

As the half wound down, Arsenal's frustration grew with misplaced passes and failed attacking moves. By the 45th minute, a blinkered run by Daley Blind nearly extended Unitedâ€™s lead but was thwarted by a chaotic scramble in the box. The subsequent corner was equally fruitless, and the first half ended with Manchester United holding onto their 1-0 advantage.

The second half began with Arsenal kicking off, looking revitalized and eager to overturn the deficit. However, the early exchanges continued to favor Manchester United. Francis Coquelinâ€™s foul on Antonio Valencia in the opening minutes set the tone for a scrappy second period.

Arsenalâ€™s first real sight of goal in the second half came from a Nacho Monreal corner in the 6th minute, but Mesut Ozil failed to find his target, and Alexis Sanchezâ€™s follow-up was high and wide. Arsenal was coming back into the game but struggled to break down Unitedâ€™s defense orchestrated by Chris Smalling and Phil Jones.

Manchester United fashioned another opportunity through a long-range effort from Marcos Rojo, which was saved by David Ospina. United continued to stretch the play, with the introduction of Robin van Persie adding a new dimension to their attack, replacing Falcao around the 60th minute mark. 

Arsene Wenger responded with his own changes, bringing on Theo Walcott and Jack Wilshere, hoping to inject some attacking impetus. Despite these changes, Arsenal was denied time and again by a resilient United defense and the impressive David de Gea.

Injuries started to play their part, with United forced into further substitutions. Marcos Rojo made way for Tyler Blackett, and a significant moment saw David de Gea replaced by Victor Valdes, following an injury that left van Gaal with no choice but to introduce his backup keeper.

The game took a dramatic turn in the 82nd minute. Arsenal's persistence paid off, albeit with a slice of fortune. Theo Walcottâ€™s cross deflected off Tyler Blackett and wrong-footed Valdes, nestling into the back of the net for an own goal. The score was level, much to the dismay of the United faithful but a huge relief for the travelling Arsenal supporters.

The final minutes saw frenetic attempts from both sides to snatch a late winner. Chris Smallingâ€™s header forced a sublime save from Ospina, while at the other end, Arsenalâ€™s Olivier Giroud narrowly missed the target with a shot that could have sealed the three points.

United's relentless pursuit for a second goal saw Robin van Persie almost create a chance, only to be flagged offside. Arsenal, meanwhile, continued to threaten on the break, with Alexis Sanchez drawing a save from the newly introduced Valdes.

The refereeâ€™s whistle brought an end to an engaging and pulsating match. A game of two halves, Manchester United had dominated the first, and despite not capitalizing on their chances, held a slender lead. The second half, a story of Arsenalâ€™s dogged determination, saw them snatch a point with a fortuitous own goal.

As the final whistle blew, both managers might have felt a sense of missed opportunity. Louis van Gaal would rue his side's lack of clinical edge, while Arsene Wenger, though relieved with the equalizer, might ponder what could have been with better execution in the final third.

In summary, it was a match that exemplified the competitive spirit of the Premier League. It saw Manchester United taking the lead through a brilliant Ander Herrera strike, only for Arsenal to claw back late through a stroke of luck. Both sets of fans were treated to moments of excitement, tactical battles, and sheer drama, the ingredients that once again affirmed why this fixture remains one of the most eagerly anticipated in English football.
